examples.content: What are the general principles of VGU's undergraduate admission?

VGU ensures fairness and transparency in its admission process. It admits students regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, or economic status. Admission is based on academic performance and relevant qualifications.
What is Method 1 of admission at VGU?
Method 1 is based on the TestAS exam. Applicants can take either the Paper-based or Digital TestAS, which includes a core test and a subject module specific to their chosen major.
What are the subject modules for TestAS?
For CSE: Mathematics, Computer Science, and Natural Sciences. For ECE, MEN, SME, BCE, ARC, MEC: Engineering. For BFA, BBA, BSE: Economics.
What are the passing scores for the Digital TestAS?
Applicants must score at least 50 in both the core and subject modules, with a total score of at least 75.
What is Method 2 of admission at VGU?
Method 2 is based on high school academic records. Applicants are assessed on the average grades of six selected subjects over three years.
What subjects are considered for Method 2?
Subjects vary by major. For example, CSE considers Math, IT, Literature, and 3 electives such as English, Physics, Chemistry, etc.
Who qualifies for bonus points under Method 2?
Applicants with an IELTS 6.0+ or from a gifted high school receive 0.25 points each, up to 0.5 points in total.
What is Method 3 of admission at VGU?
Method 3 is for direct admission of outstanding students, such as winners of national/international academic competitions or students with consistent high performance and strong English skills.
Who is eligible for direct admission (Method 3)?
Applicants who are national team members for international Olympiads, winners of national/provincial academic competitions, or top-performing students in high school with high English proficiency.
What is Method 4 of admission at VGU?
Method 4 is based on international high school certificates or aptitude tests like SAT, ACT, IB, A-Level, WACE, GED, etc.
What are the required scores for SAT and ACT under Method 4?
SAT: minimum 1150, ACT: minimum 23.
What is the IB score requirement for VGU admission?
A total score of 28 across 6 subjects.
What is Method 5 of admission at VGU?
Method 5 is based on high school graduation exam results. Applicants must meet the minimum score in three subject combinations relevant to their major.
Can I use past years' graduation exam results for admission?
Yes, you may use results from the current or previous years for Method 5 admission.
What are the subject combinations for ARC (Architecture)?
A00 (Math, Physics, Chemistry), A01 (Math, Physics, English), D26 (Math, Physics, German), V00 (Math, Physics, Art), C01 (Math, Physics, Literature).
What documents are needed to apply for transfer admission?
ID/passport, high school transcript and diploma, university transcript, international test scores (if any), and English certificate (if any).
What are the conditions for transfer admission?
The new major must be similar to the previous one, the applicant must meet VGU's minimum score, and not be under academic penalty at their current university.
Can transfer students receive talent scholarships?
No, transfer students are not eligible for talent scholarships.
What is the process to defer admission?
Applicants must submit a deferment request and supporting documents by December 15 of the admission year. Valid reasons include military service, national duty, or medical emergencies.
How long can admission be deferred?
Up to 1 year for health or national duty reasons, and up to 3 years for military service.
Can applicants use both TestAS and international certificates for admission?

Yes, applicants may submit a valid TestAS score or equivalent international certificates (e.g., SAT, ACT) under Method 1 or Method 4. If a certificate is submitted, the TestAS exam fee may be refunded if done at least 2 weeks before the test date.
Can I apply to multiple admission methods at VGU?
Yes, applicants may apply to multiple methods, but they must follow each method's deadlines and procedures. Admission decisions and scholarships for each method are made independently.
What is included in the admission notice from VGU?

It includes an official or conditional admission letter signed by the Admission Council Chairman, showing entrance scores and scholarship information if applicable. It also includes the Enrollment Guide with required documents, tuition, and enrollment timeline.
What if a student fails the national high school exam?
Students who fail the national high school graduation exam are not eligible to enroll at VGU.
Who is exempted from English language requirements?
Applicants from countries where English is an official language or those who graduated from international high school programs taught and assessed entirely in English are exempted.
What is the process for TestAS applicants to receive the exam invitation?
Once a valid application is submitted and the exam fee is paid, VGU will issue an exam invitation letter with details on the test date, time, location, and allowed materials.
Can students take the English test at VGU?
Yes, students without a valid English certificate can take VGU’s English test, which includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing. The fee is 500,000 VND per attempt.
What is the combined score formula for TestAS?
Combined score = 40% Core Module + 60% Subject Module.
What are the requirements for recognition of international certificates?
Each certificate has specific minimum scores and subject requirements. For example, A-Level requires an average of 70% with one full A-Level and the rest can be AS-Level or IGCSE combinations.
Can students with low GPA in international diplomas still be admitted?
Students with GPA below 70% may still be admitted if their class rank is high and the Admission Council approves it.
Can I use an international high school diploma not listed in the appendices?
Only diplomas listed in Appendix 3 are accepted. Others may require validation, translation, and an interview to assess eligibility.
What are examples of valid English proficiency tests accepted by VGU?
VGU accepts IELTS, TOEFL iBT, PTE Academic, Cambridge English, and Aptis (for placement purposes only). Details are in Appendix 1.
What is the bonus for attending a gifted high school?
Applicants from recognized gifted high schools receive 0.25 bonus points toward their academic average under Method 2.
Who reviews transfer credit requests for transferred students?
The academic program coordinator evaluates each request individually and decides on transfer credit recognition.
Are transferred students eligible for VGU scholarships?
No, transfer students are not eligible for VGU talent-based scholarships.
What is the timeline for requesting admission deferral?
Requests must be submitted with supporting documents before December 15 of the admission year.
When must deferred students request to resume their studies?
They must submit a request to resume by August 15 to begin in the first semester of the academic year.
Can VGU cancel or delay an admission method?
Yes, the Admission Council can adjust, delay, or cancel admission methods in cases of force majeure or other special circumstances.
What is the role of the Admission Council at VGU?
The Council organizes and oversees all admission procedures, resolves complaints, sets cutoff scores, and reports to the Ministry of Education.
What does the Secretary Board of the Admission Council do?
They publish info, verify documents, collect fees, manage entrance tests, compile admission results, and handle applicant communications.
